cards.name: The Fool
cards.meaning_up: Beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, a free spirit
cards.meaning_rev: Holding back, recklessness, risk-taking
cards.desc: The Fool stands on the edge of a cliff, with the sun shining brightly behind him. He carries a small bundle, representing untapped potential. A small dog follows him, representing loyalty and protection.

cards.name: The Magician
cards.meaning_up: Manifestation, resourcefulness, power, inspired action
cards.meaning_rev: Manipulation, poor planning, untapped talents
cards.desc: The Magician stands with one arm raised towards the sky and the other pointing to the earth, symbolizing the connection between the spiritual and material realms. On the table before him are the symbols of the four Tarot suits, representing the four elements.

cards.name: The High Priestess
cards.meaning_up: Intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, the subconscious mind
cards.meaning_rev: Secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal and silence
cards.desc: The High Priestess sits in front of a thin veil decorated with pomegranates. She holds a scroll with the word 'TORA', signifying greater law and wisdom. The moon at her feet and the crown on her head represent her connection to the divine feminine.

cards.name: The Empress
cards.meaning_up: Femininity, beauty, nature, nurturing, abundance
cards.meaning_rev: Creative block, dependence on others
cards.desc: The Empress is seated on a throne, surrounded by a lush forest and a river flowing through it. She wears a crown of stars, symbolizing her connection with the mystical realm and cycles of nature.

cards.name: The Emperor
cards.meaning_up: Authority, establishment, structure, a father figure
cards.meaning_rev: Domination, excessive control, lack of discipline, inflexibility
cards.desc: The Emperor sits on a large stone throne adorned with ram heads, symbolizing his association with Aries and Mars. He holds an ankh in one hand and a globe in the other, representing his rule and dominion.

cards.name: The Hierophant
cards.meaning_up: Spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition, institutions
cards.meaning_rev: Personal beliefs, freedom, challenging the status quo
cards.desc: The Hierophant sits between two pillars of a sacred temple, with his right hand raised in blessing. Before him kneel two followers, symbolizing the transfer of spiritual knowledge within formal institutions.

cards.name: The Lovers
cards.meaning_up: Love, harmony, relationships, values alignment, choices
cards.meaning_rev: Self-love, disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values
cards.desc: The Lovers depicts a man and a woman standing in a beautiful garden, with the Archangel Raphael blessing them. Behind the man is the Tree of Life, and behind the woman is the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil.

cards.name: The Chariot
cards.meaning_up: Control, willpower, success, action, determination
cards.meaning_rev: Self-discipline, opposition, lack of direction
cards.desc: The Chariot shows a warrior standing in a chariot pulled by two sphinxes, one black and one white, representing duality and the need to navigate opposing forces. He wears a crown and a star-studded canopy above him.

cards.name: Strength
cards.meaning_up: Strength, courage, persuasion, influence, compassion
cards.meaning_rev: Self-doubt, weakness, insecurity
cards.desc: Strength depicts a woman gently holding the jaws of a lion, demonstrating the calming and taming of raw emotions. Above her head is the symbol of infinity, representing infinite potential and wisdom.

cards.name: The Hermit
cards.meaning_up: Soul-searching, introspection, being alone, inner guidance
cards.meaning_rev: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal
cards.desc: The Hermit stands alone on a mountain peak, holding a lantern with a six-pointed star inside. He uses the light of his lantern to guide his path, symbolizing the search for inner wisdom.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.meaning_up: Good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, a turning point
cards.meaning_rev: Bad luck, resistance to change, breaking cycles
cards.desc: The Wheel of Fortune depicts a large wheel with different creatures around it, representing the cyclical nature of life. The four creatures in the corners symbolize the four elements and the four fixed signs of the zodiac.

cards.name: Justice
cards.meaning_up: Justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, law
cards.meaning_rev: Unfairness, lack of accountability, dishonesty
cards.desc: Justice sits between two pillars, holding a sword in her right hand and scales in her left, representing balance and impartiality. She wears a crown with a small square, symbolizing well-ordered thoughts.

cards.name: The Hanged Man
cards.meaning_up: Pause, surrender, letting go, new perspectives
cards.meaning_rev: Delays, resistance, stalling, indecision
cards.desc: The Hanged Man hangs upside down from a tree, with a serene expression on his face, indicating his acceptance of his situation. A halo around his head signifies enlightenment and new insight.

cards.name: Death
cards.meaning_up: Endings, change, transformation, transition
cards.meaning_rev: Resistance to change, personal transformation, inner purging
cards.desc: Death is depicted as a skeletal figure riding a white horse, carrying a black flag with a white rose. People from all classes of society stand before him, symbolizing the inevitability of change and transformation.

cards.name: Temperance
cards.meaning_up: Balance, moderation, patience, purpose
cards.meaning_rev: Imbalance, excess, self-healing, re-alignment
cards.desc: Temperance shows an angel with one foot on land and one foot in water, symbolizing balance between the material and spiritual worlds. The angel pours water between two cups, representing the flow and balance of life.

cards.name: The Devil
cards.meaning_up: Shadow self, attachment, addiction, restriction, sexuality
cards.meaning_rev: Releasing limiting beliefs, exploring dark thoughts, detachment
cards.desc: The Devil sits on a black throne, with a pentagram above his head. Two figures are chained to the throne, symbolizing bondage and attachment to materialism and base desires.

cards.name: The Tower
cards.meaning_up: Sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation, awakening
cards.meaning_rev: Personal transformation, fear of change, averting disaster
cards.desc: The Tower depicts a tall spire struck by lightning, with flames and people falling from it. This symbolizes sudden and disruptive change that can lead to a revelation or awakening.

cards.name: The Star
cards.meaning_up: Hope, faith, purpose, renewal, spirituality
cards.meaning_rev: Lack of faith, despair, self-trust, disconnection
cards.desc: The Star shows a woman kneeling by the water, pouring water from two containers. One foot is on the land and one foot in the water, symbolizing the balance between the practical and spiritual aspects of life. Above her head, seven small stars and one large star shine brightly.

cards.name: The Moon
cards.meaning_up: Illusion, fear, anxiety, subconscious, intuition
cards.meaning_rev: Release of fear, repressed emotion, inner confusion
cards.desc: The Moon depicts a full moon in the night sky, positioned between two large towers. A dog and a wolf howl at the moon while a crayfish crawls out of the water. The imagery suggests a journey through the subconscious and the exploration of inner fears.

cards.name: The Sun
cards.meaning_up: Positivity, fun, warmth, success, vitality
cards.meaning_rev: Inner child, feeling down, overly optimistic
cards.desc: The Sun shows a radiant sun shining down on a young child riding a white horse. The child represents innocence and purity, while the sunflowers in the background symbolize happiness and abundance.

cards.name: Judgement
cards.meaning_up: Judgement, rebirth, inner calling, absolution
cards.meaning_rev: Self-doubt, inner critic, ignoring the call
cards.desc: Judgement depicts an angel blowing a trumpet, while people rise from their graves. The scene represents a call to a higher purpose and the judgement of past actions, leading to rebirth and renewal.

cards.name: The World
cards.meaning_up: Completion, integration, accomplishment, travel
cards.meaning_rev: Seeking personal closure, short-cuts, delays
cards.desc: The World shows a naked woman dancing inside a large wreath, symbolizing completion and the cycle of life. She holds two wands, representing balance and evolution. The four figures in the corners represent the four elements and the four fixed signs of the zodiac.

cards.name: Ace of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Inspiration, new opportunities, growth, potential
cards.meaning_rev: An emerging idea, lack of direction, distractions, delays
cards.desc: The Ace of Wands shows a hand emerging from a cloud, holding a sprouting wand. The landscape below indicates fertile land and new beginnings.

cards.name: Two of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Future planning, progress, decisions, discovery
cards.meaning_rev: Personal goals, inner alignment, fear of the unknown, lack of planning
cards.desc: The Two of Wands depicts a man standing on a castle, holding a globe and a wand, looking out over the sea and mountains, symbolizing exploration and future planning.

cards.name: Three of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Progress, expansion, foresight, overseas opportunities
cards.meaning_rev: Playing small, lack of foresight, unexpected delays
cards.desc: The Three of Wands shows a man standing on a cliff, looking out at three ships sailing away, representing the implementation of plans and seeing projects through to completion.

cards.name: Four of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Celebration, joy, harmony, relaxation, homecoming
cards.meaning_rev: Personal celebration, inner harmony, conflict with others, transition
cards.desc: The Four of Wands shows two women holding flowers, celebrating beneath a floral canopy. In the background, people are rejoicing near a large castle, indicating stability and security.

cards.name: Five of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Conflict, competition, tension, diversity
cards.meaning_rev: Inner conflict, conflict avoidance, tension release
cards.desc: The Five of Wands depicts five men each holding a wand, seemingly in conflict with each other, representing strife and competition.

cards.name: Six of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Success, public recognition, progress, self-confidence
cards.meaning_rev: Private achievement, personal definition of success, fall from grace, egotism
cards.desc: The Six of Wands shows a man riding a horse through a cheering crowd, holding a wand adorned with a laurel wreath, symbolizing victory and public acknowledgment.

cards.name: Seven of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Challenge, competition, protection, perseverance
cards.meaning_rev: Exhaustion, giving up, overwhelmed
cards.desc: The Seven of Wands depicts a man on a hill, defending his position against six other wands, symbolizing standing up for what you believe in despite challenges.

cards.name: Eight of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Movement, fast-paced change, action, alignment
cards.meaning_rev: Delays, frustration, resisting change, internal alignment
cards.desc: The Eight of Wands shows eight wands flying through the air, indicating swift movement and progress towards a goal.

cards.name: Nine of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Resilience, courage, persistence, test of faith, boundaries
cards.meaning_rev: Inner resources, struggle, overwhelm, defensive
cards.desc: The Nine of Wands depicts a weary man with a bandaged head, holding a wand and standing guard with eight wands behind him, symbolizing resilience and determination.

cards.name: Ten of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Burden, extra responsibility, hard work, completion
cards.meaning_rev: Doing it all, carrying the burden, delegation, release
cards.desc: The Ten of Wands shows a man carrying a heavy load of ten wands, indicating the burdens and responsibilities that come with success.

cards.name: Page of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Inspiration, ideas, discovery, limitless potential, free spirit
cards.meaning_rev: Newly-formed ideas, redirecting energy, self-limiting beliefs, a spiritual path
cards.desc: The Page of Wands depicts a young man holding a wand and looking at it with curiosity, symbolizing the exploration of new ideas and potential.

cards.name: Knight of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Energy, passion, inspired action, adventure, impulsiveness
cards.meaning_rev: Passion project, haste, scattered energy, delays, frustration
cards.desc: The Knight of Wands shows a knight riding a horse at full speed, holding a wand, symbolizing action, adventure, and impulsiveness.

cards.name: Queen of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Courage, confidence, independence, social butterfly, determination
cards.meaning_rev: Self-respect, self-confidence, introverted, re-establish sense of self
cards.desc: The Queen of Wands sits on a throne adorned with lions and sunflower motifs, symbolizing courage, confidence, and a connection with nature and the spiritual realm.

cards.name: King of Wands
cards.meaning_up: Natural-born leader, vision, entrepreneur, honor
cards.meaning_rev: Impulsiveness, haste, ruthless, high expectations
cards.desc: The King of Wands sits on a throne with a wand in hand, symbolizing leadership, vision, and honor. He is surrounded by salamanders, representing transformation and passion.

cards.name: Ace of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Love, new relationships, compassion, creativity
cards.meaning_rev: Self-love, intuition, repressed emotions
cards.desc: The Ace of Cups shows a hand emerging from a cloud, holding a cup from which five streams of water flow, representing the outpouring of emotions and the divine source of love and compassion.

cards.name: Two of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Unified love, partnership, mutual attraction
cards.meaning_rev: Self-love, break-ups, disharmony, distrust
cards.desc: The Two of Cups depicts a man and a woman exchanging cups and pledging their love for each other, symbolizing unity, partnership, and mutual attraction.

cards.name: Three of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Celebration, friendship, creativity, collaborations
cards.meaning_rev: Independence, alone time, hardcore partying, 'three's a crowd'
cards.desc: The Three of Cups shows three women dancing and raising their cups in celebration, representing friendship, joy, and creative collaborations.

cards.name: Four of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Meditation, contemplation, apathy, reevaluation
cards.meaning_rev: Retreat, withdrawal, checking in for alignment
cards.desc: The Four of Cups depicts a man sitting under a tree, with three cups in front of him and a fourth cup being offered by a hand from a cloud. He appears lost in thought, indicating contemplation and reevaluation.

cards.name: Five of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Regret, failure, disappointment, pessimism
cards.meaning_rev: Personal setbacks, self-forgiveness, moving on
cards.desc: The Five of Cups shows a figure in a black cloak looking at three spilled cups, symbolizing regret and loss, while two cups remain standing behind him, representing remaining opportunities.

cards.name: Six of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Revisiting the past, childhood memories, innocence, joy
cards.meaning_rev: Living in the past, forgiveness, lacking playfulness
cards.desc: The Six of Cups depicts a young boy giving a cup filled with flowers to a young girl, symbolizing nostalgia, innocence, and happy memories from the past.

cards.name: Seven of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Opportunities, choices, wishful thinking, illusion
cards.meaning_rev: Alignment, personal values, overwhelmed by choices
cards.desc: The Seven of Cups shows a man gazing at seven cups filled with different objects, representing various choices and opportunities, as well as the potential for illusion and wishful thinking.

cards.name: Eight of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Disappointment, abandonment, withdrawal, escapism
cards.meaning_rev: Trying one more time, indecision, aimless drifting, walking away
cards.desc: The Eight of Cups depicts a figure walking away from a stack of cups under a moonlit sky, symbolizing the decision to leave behind what is no longer fulfilling.

cards.name: Nine of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Contentment, satisfaction, gratitude, wish come true
cards.meaning_rev: Inner happiness, materialism, dissatisfaction
cards.desc: The Nine of Cups shows a man sitting in front of nine cups arranged in an arc, symbolizing contentment and satisfaction with what one has achieved.

cards.name: Ten of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Divine love, blissful relationships, harmony, alignment
cards.meaning_rev: Disconnection, misaligned values, struggling relationships
cards.desc: The Ten of Cups depicts a happy family with children dancing and parents embracing under a rainbow of ten cups, symbolizing harmony, happiness, and fulfillment in relationships.

cards.name: Page of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Creative opportunities, intuitive messages, curiosity, possibility
cards.meaning_rev: New ideas, doubting intuition, creative blocks, emotional immaturity
cards.desc: The Page of Cups shows a young man holding a cup with a fish popping out, symbolizing creative inspiration and new emotional experiences.

cards.name: Knight of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Romance, charm, 'Knight in shining armor,' imagination
cards.meaning_rev: Overactive imagination, unrealistic, jealous, moody
cards.desc: The Knight of Cups depicts a knight riding a white horse and holding a cup, symbolizing the pursuit of romance and idealistic dreams.

cards.name: Queen of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Compassionate, caring, emotionally stable, intuitive, in flow
cards.meaning_rev: Inner feelings, self-care, co-dependency, martyrdom
cards.desc: The Queen of Cups sits on a throne at the edge of the sea, holding a cup. She represents emotional stability, compassion, and intuitive understanding.

cards.name: King of Cups
cards.meaning_up: Emotionally balanced, compassionate, diplomatic
cards.meaning_rev: Self-compassion, inner feelings, moodiness, emotionally manipulative
cards.desc: The King of Cups sits on a throne surrounded by water, holding a cup and a scepter, symbolizing emotional control and compassion balanced with strength.

cards.name: Ace of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Breakthrough, clarity, sharp mind
cards.meaning_rev: Inner clarity, re-thinking an idea, clouded judgment
cards.desc: The Ace of Swords shows a hand emerging from a cloud, holding a sword with a crown and laurel wreath, symbolizing a breakthrough or a new understanding.

cards.name: Two of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Difficult decisions, weighing up options, an impasse, avoidance
cards.meaning_rev: Indecision, confusion, information overload, stalemate
cards.desc: The Two of Swords depicts a blindfolded woman holding two crossed swords, symbolizing difficult decisions and stalemates.

cards.name: Three of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Heartbreak, emotional pain, sorrow, grief, hurt
cards.meaning_rev: Negative self-talk, releasing pain, optimism, forgiveness
cards.desc: The Three of Swords shows a heart pierced by three swords, symbolizing heartbreak, emotional pain, and grief.

cards.name: Four of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Rest, relaxation, meditation, contemplation, recuperation
cards.meaning_rev: Exhaustion, burnout, deep contemplation, stagnation
cards.desc: The Four of Swords depicts a knight lying on a tomb, with hands in a prayer position, symbolizing rest and recuperation after a struggle.

cards.name: Five of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Conflict, disagreements, competition, defeat, winning at all costs
cards.meaning_rev: Reconciliation, making amends, past resentment
cards.desc: The Five of Swords shows a man picking up three swords from the ground, while two other figures walk away in the background, symbolizing conflict and defeat.

cards.name: Six of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Transition, change, rite of passage, releasing baggage
cards.meaning_rev: Personal transition, resistance to change, unfinished business
cards.desc: The Six of Swords depicts a figure rowing a boat with a woman and child, symbolizing a journey away from difficulties towards calmer waters.

cards.name: Seven of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Betrayal, deception, getting away with something, acting strategically
cards.meaning_rev: Imposter syndrome, self-deceit, keeping secrets
cards.desc: The Seven of Swords shows a man sneaking away from a camp with five swords in hand, symbolizing betrayal, deception, and strategy.

cards.name: Eight of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Negative thoughts, self-imposed restriction, imprisonment, victim mentality
cards.meaning_rev: Self-limiting beliefs, inner critic, releasing negative thoughts, open to new perspectives
cards.desc: The Eight of Swords depicts a woman bound and blindfolded, surrounded by eight swords, symbolizing feeling trapped and restricted by one's thoughts.

cards.name: Nine of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Anxiety, worry, fear, depression, nightmares
cards.meaning_rev: Inner turmoil, deep-seated fears, secrets, releasing worry
cards.desc: The Nine of Swords shows a woman sitting up in bed with her head in her hands, symbolizing anxiety, worry, and sleepless nights.

cards.name: Ten of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Painful endings, deep wounds, betrayal, loss, crisis
cards.meaning_rev: Recovery, regeneration, resisting an inevitable end
cards.desc: The Ten of Swords depicts a man lying face down with ten swords stabbed into his back, symbolizing painful endings and betrayal.

cards.name: Page of Swords
cards.meaning_up: New ideas, curiosity, thirst for knowledge, new ways of communicating
cards.meaning_rev: Self-expression, all talk and no action, haphazard action, haste
cards.desc: The Page of Swords depicts a young figure holding a sword upright, symbolizing curiosity, new ideas, and a desire for knowledge.

cards.name: Knight of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Ambitious, action-oriented, driven to succeed, fast-thinking
cards.meaning_rev: Restless, unfocused, impulsive, burnt out
cards.desc: The Knight of Swords shows a knight charging forward on his horse, with his sword held high, symbolizing ambition, action, and drive.

cards.name: Queen of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Independent, unbiased judgment, clear boundaries, direct communication
cards.meaning_rev: Overly-emotional, easily influenced, bitchy, cold-hearted
cards.desc: The Queen of Swords sits on her throne with her sword held upright, symbolizing independence, clear judgment, and direct communication.

cards.name: King of Swords
cards.meaning_up: Mental clarity, intellectual power, authority, truth
cards.meaning_rev: Quiet power, inner truth, misuse of power, manipulation
cards.desc: The King of Swords sits on his throne holding a sword, symbolizing mental clarity, authority, and intellectual power.

cards.name: Ace of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: A new financial or career opportunity, manifestation, abundance
cards.meaning_rev: Lost opportunity, lack of planning and foresight
cards.desc: The Ace of Pentacles depicts a hand emerging from a cloud, holding a pentacle, symbolizing new financial opportunities and abundance.

cards.name: Two of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Multiple priorities, time management, prioritisation, adaptability
cards.meaning_rev: Over-committed, disorganisation, reprioritisation
cards.desc: The Two of Pentacles shows a man juggling two pentacles in an infinite loop, symbolizing balance and adaptability amidst multiple priorities.

cards.name: Three of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Teamwork, collaboration, learning, implementation
cards.meaning_rev: Disharmony, misalignment, working alone
cards.desc: The Three of Pentacles depicts three people working together on a building project, symbolizing teamwork and collaboration.

cards.name: Four of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Saving money, security, conservatism, scarcity, control
cards.meaning_rev: Over-spending, greed, self-protection
cards.desc: The Four of Pentacles shows a man holding tightly to his pentacles, symbolizing security, control, and conservatism with money.

cards.name: Five of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Financial loss, poverty, lack mindset, isolation, worry
cards.meaning_rev: Recovery from financial loss, spiritual poverty
cards.desc: The Five of Pentacles depicts two figures walking in the snow outside a church, symbolizing financial loss and isolation, but also hope for assistance and recovery.

cards.name: Six of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Giving, receiving, sharing wealth, generosity, charity
cards.meaning_rev: Self-care, unpaid debts, one-sided charity
cards.desc: The Six of Pentacles shows a wealthy man giving coins to two beggars, symbolizing generosity, charity, and the balance between giving and receiving.

cards.name: Seven of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Long-term view, sustainable results, perseverance, investment
cards.meaning_rev: Lack of long-term vision, limited success or reward
cards.desc: The Seven of Pentacles depicts a man looking at his garden, symbolizing the results of long-term efforts and investments.

cards.name: Eight of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Apprenticeship, repetitive tasks, mastery, skill development
cards.meaning_rev: Self-development, perfectionism, misdirected activity
cards.desc: The Eight of Pentacles shows a man diligently working on pentacles, symbolizing skill development and the pursuit of mastery.

cards.name: Nine of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Abundance, luxury, self-sufficiency, financial independence
cards.meaning_rev: Self-worth, over-investment in work, hustling
cards.desc: The Nine of Pentacles depicts a woman surrounded by her vineyard, symbolizing financial independence, luxury, and abundance.

cards.name: Ten of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Wealth, financial security, family, long-term success, contribution
cards.meaning_rev: The dark side of wealth, financial failure or loss
cards.desc: The Ten of Pentacles shows an elderly man surrounded by family, symbolizing financial security, legacy, and long-term success.

cards.name: Page of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Manifestation, financial opportunity, skill development
cards.meaning_rev: Lack of progress, procrastination, learn from failure
cards.desc: The Page of Pentacles shows a young man examining a pentacle, symbolizing new opportunities in finance and skill development.

cards.name: Knight of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Hard work, productivity, routine, conservatism
cards.meaning_rev: Self-discipline, boredom, feeling 'stuck,' perfectionism
cards.desc: The Knight of Pentacles depicts a knight riding a horse slowly and steadily, symbolizing hard work, productivity, and a methodical approach.

cards.name: Queen of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Nurturing, practical, providing financially, a working parent
cards.meaning_rev: Financial independence, self-care, work-home conflict
cards.desc: The Queen of Pentacles sits on a throne adorned with carvings of fruit and flowers, symbolizing nurturing, practicality, and financial provision.

cards.name: King of Pentacles
cards.meaning_up: Wealth, business, leadership, security, discipline, abundance
cards.meaning_rev: Financially inept, obsessed with wealth, stubborn
cards.desc: The King of Pentacles sits on a throne decorated with symbols of wealth and abundance, representing leadership, business acumen, and financial security.
